description: Hillstream BioPharma, Inc., a pre-clinical biotechnology company, develops novel therapeutic candidates targeting ferroptosis, an anti-cancer mechanism resulting in iron mediated cell death (IMCD) for the treatment resistant cancers. The company's product candidate is HSB-1216, an IMCD inducer targeting solid tumors. It also develops HSB-888, a dual Quatramer loaded IMCD inducer coupled with its anthracycline analogue for solid tumors; HSB-510, a targeted bifunctional inhibitory compound in Quatramer with single digit nanomolar IC50 against PI3K-delta and HDAC6, which is also known to downregulate; and HSB-114, an immunotherapeutic agent, which uses its Quatramer technology to deliver tumor necrosis factor-alpha gene into cancer cells. The company was incorporated in 2017 and is based in Bridgewater, New Jersey.
